title: Save bookmarks shortcut does not respect selection anymore.
content: I remember in ff129 and earlier, when I selected tabs and pressed ctrl+shift+d it saved only those selected tabs into a specified folder name. Now firefox saves ALL open tabs regardless of selection. I really hope mozilla didn't make this regression deliberately because it was one of my most used shortcuts.

title: Problems with Website Reloading in Firefox
content:
Hi Firefox Community,

I am facing a problem with my website, https://baddiesonlytv.org/, particularly on the Firefox browser. Although the site operates correctly on other browsers, it is not reloading properly in Firefox.

Issue Description:

Website URL: https://baddiesonlytv.org/ Problem: The site reloads inconsistently or fails to load completely on Firefox. Affected Browsers: Firefox (the issue does not occur in Chrome, Edge, or Safari). Steps Taken:

Cleared the cache and cookies in Firefox. Checked for any extensions that might be causing conflicts. Confirmed that the issue persists across multiple devices using Firefox. What I Need Help With:

Suggestions: Any recommendations for potential fixes or troubleshooting steps specific to Firefox. Insights: If there are any known issues or recent updates that could be impacting Firefox compatibility. I would greatly appreciate any assistance or insights. Thank you!

Best regards,
creator: letmewatchthissinfo

title: Generally slow browsing on sites like youtube, twitch, and amazon
content: For the past several weeks I have been having issues where some parts of websites don't load like on Twitch and amazon, and YouTube videos are choppy and pause playback frequently. I have a 7800 X3D CPU, 32 GB of DDR5, and gigabit Ethernet so its not a problem with outdated hardware. I also reinstalled the newest drivers twice, updated my bios, updated Windows, and reset my router so I'm not really sure whats causing the problem. I tested twitch and youtube on Edge and the issues are kinda there but considerably better. I was having similar issues on youtube several months ago when I was using opera, so I switched to firefox and it seemed to fix the problem until now.
creator: dy9lan9

title: Tabs not closing when clicked randomly
content:
Every once in a while a tab will not close when I click the X. I am able to switch between tabs and use everything else like normal when this issue is happening. The X will still highlight, I am able to close other tabs just not a specific one. Literally the only thing that will not work is actually clicking the X and having the tab actually close. To close it I will have to drag it to make it its own window and then it will allow me to click the X.

I have not noticed a pattern to what tabs randomly decide to do this or the frequency to how often it happens.
creator: emppme14

title: Firefox freezes on me a good deal. I then try to kill the firefox processes and one remains and can't be killed.
content:
Firefox freezes on me a good deal. I then try to kill the Firefox processes and one remains and can't be killed. This is windows 10 and yes I have tried all the available methods of killing a process.

PS C:\WINDOWS\system32> tasklist| Select-String "Firefox.exe"

firefox.exe 7948 Console 1 272,236 K

PS C:\WINDOWS\system32> taskkill /im "firefox.exe" /t /f ERROR: The process with PID 7948 (child process of PID 5388) could not be terminated. Reason: There is no running instance of the task. SUCCESS: The process with PID 2512 (child process of PID 376) has been terminated. PS C:\WINDOWS\system32>
creator: moracemonn

title: Firefox is not working with Shopify
content:
Firefox is not working with Shopify. I have tried the following troubleshooting steps and I do see:

1. Update Firefox to the Latest Version Go to Menu (â‰¡) > Help > About Firefox. This will automatically check for updates. Regular updates ensure compatibility with modern web apps like Shopify. 2. Clear Cache, Cookies, and Site Data Go to Menu (â‰¡) > Settings > Privacy & Security. Under Cookies and Site Data, click Manage Data. Search for "Shopify" to delete only Shopify-related data, or use Clear Data to remove all cached data, which can resolve display issues in Admin. 3. Run Firefox in Troubleshoot Mode (Enhanced Safe Mode) Firefox 2024 includes a robust Troubleshoot Mode that disables extensions, custom settings, and themes, giving a clean environment. Go to Menu (â‰¡) > Help > Troubleshoot Mode. Choose Restart in Troubleshoot Mode, then Open when prompted. If Shopify Admin works in this mode, an extension or setting is likely causing the issue. 4. Check for Incompatible Extensions and Privacy Add-ons Go to Menu (â‰¡) > Add-ons and Themes > Extensions. Disable extensions, especially ad blockers, VPNs, and script blockers, which may conflict with Shopify's dynamic elements. Reload Shopify Admin after disabling each extension to pinpoint any issues. 5. Disable Enhanced Tracking Protection for Shopify Firefoxâ€™s Enhanced Tracking Protection may block essential cookies and scripts used by Shopify. Open Shopify Admin, click the shield icon next to the address bar, and select Turn off Enhanced Tracking Protection for This Site. 6. Disable Hardware Acceleration Some display issues stem from hardware acceleration conflicts. Go to Menu (â‰¡) > Settings > General > Performance. Uncheck Use hardware acceleration when available and restart Firefox. 7. Use Firefoxâ€™s DevTools to Diagnose Errors Open Menu (â‰¡) > Web Developer > Web Console or press Ctrl + Shift + K. Reload Shopify Admin to see if any errors or blocked elements are logged, which can provide insight into potential conflicts or missing resources. 8. Verify Network Security and Check Proxy/VPN Settings If your network includes a firewall or proxy, ensure that it allows secure access to all Shopify domains. Disable VPNs temporarily to check if theyâ€™re impacting Shopify Admin performance.
creator: gberryhill32
